rev.comment: /* In fiction */ Rm OR; unsourced = speculation

The Denver Post wrote a misquote to Tim Ralph, which was only stated on Feburary 19, 2007 in the Rocky Mtn News.

accurate quote style for given "completely heterosexual" quote

removed highly unflattering picture. we don't need a picture of him kissing babies, but one where heappear to be snarling would be nice.

revert, per [[WP:PUNC]]. please read the [[WP:MOS|Wikipedia Manual of Style]] before changing punctuation.
/* In fiction */ Again, setting punctuation INSIDE any quote marks. Like, "this." Quote marks belong outside all punctuation. This is a very popular error.
/* Claims of "complete heterosexuality" */ Some punctuation replacement and correction. Very minor.
/* Response to allegations */ addition of one comma that was missing.
/* Allegations */ I'm properly setting the punctuation inside any quote marks. Minor edit only.

/* News articles and interviews */ shortening URL
Revert. "to his congregation" should remain as it is. Other interpretations will need to have a source.
/* External links */ Added a new article in the LA Times on Ted Haggard's counseling

/* Sex and methamphetamine scandal */ rv - the source says college guys 18-22, does not mention twinks, nor hairless, nor blonds or other twink descriptions. we should avoid defining what Haggard said
/* Allegations */ 'Young college guys' led to Twink (disambiguation). Now leads to twink (gay slang), which I presume is the appropriate page.
Sorry, that reads like an essay. Please put this on a blog, or find sources rather than posting original research
I don't think we even need this clause at all.
Rm POV, please take this to talk - or better yet, to your blog
